subject: biology
hook: Your blood can KILL someone... or SAVE their life. It all depends on 4 letters!
key_points: 4 blood types: A, B, AB, O - based on ANTIGENS on RBCs
Type A has A antigens, Type B has B antigens, AB has BOTH
Type O has NO antigens - that's why it's the universal DONOR!
But O can only RECEIVE O blood - it has both anti-A and anti-B antibodies
AB is universal RECEIVER - no antibodies means it accepts everything!
core_analogy: Antigens are like ID badges on cells. Your immune system checks IDs - wrong badge = ATTACK!
mind_blow: Less than 7% of Indians have O-negative blood - the REAL universal donor. That's rarer than finding a JEE AIR-1!
exam_relevance: NEET 2024: Why does blood transfusion mismatch cause agglutination? JEE: Antigen-antibody specificity.
